message.content:
cs.IT, cs.COMM, cs.SI, cs.DS, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with information theory and communication, specifically the problem of maximum coding rate for a broadcast channel with a common message using variable-length stop-feedback codes. Therefore, cs.IT (Information Theory) and cs.COMM (Communication and Networking) are the most likely sub-categories. The paper also involves analyzing achievability and converse bounds, which could fall under cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) or cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms). Finally, the paper includes numerical evaluations and asymptotic analysis, which could be relevant to cs.LG (Machine Learning).
